intro: Ballota limbata, commonly known as the narrowleaf ballota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are compound, with narrow, elongated leaflets that give it its common name. Ballota limbata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
